item.title: S. 1778, Craig Recreation Land Purchase Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on April 28, 2004

item.title: S. 1778, Craig Recreation Land Purchase Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on April 28, 2004

summary.text: Craig Recreation Land Purchase Act - Requires: (1) that, if the City of Craig, Alaska (the City), tenders all right, title, and interest of the City in and to the municipal lands identified as the "Sunnahae Trail and Recreation Parcel and Craig Cannery Property" and dated August 2003, to the Secretary of Agriculture not later than six months after the date the City receives the results of the Secretary's appraisal, the Secretary shall accept such tender; (2) the City to use the funds received for such transfer to purchase the "Wards Cove Property"; (3) that the lands being transferred shall be of equal value; (4) the Secretary, prior to any conveyance under this Act, to conduct the appraisal of the municipal lands in accordance with specified standards; and (5) that the municipal lands received by the Secretary shall become part of the Tongass National Forest.

Craig Recreation Land Purchase Act - Requires that if the City of Craig, Alaska (the City), receives a copy of the appraisal conducted under this Act and offers to convey all right, title, and interest of the City in and to specified non-Federal land to the Secretary of Agriculture, the Secretary shall: (1) accept such offer; and (2) on conveyance of the land to the Secretary, pay to the City an amount equal to the appraised value of such land.

Requires the Secretary, before conveying the land, to conduct an appraisal of such land in accordance with specified standards.

Instructs the City and the Secretary to each pay certain costs of the appraisal.

Requires any lands acquired under this Act to be included in Tongass National Forest and to be administered by the Secretary in accordance with the laws (including regulations) and forest plan applicable to such Forest.

Requires the amount received by the City to be used by the City to acquire the Craig cannery property.

Authorizes appropriations.

(This measure has not been amended since it was reported to the Senate on May 20, 2004. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Craig Recreation Land Purchase Act - Requires that if the City of Craig, Alaska (the City), receives a copy of the appraisal conducted under this Act and offers to convey all right, title, and interest of the City in and to specified non-Federal land to the Secretary of Agriculture, the Secretary shall: (1) accept such offer; and (2) on conveyance of the land to the Secretary, pay to the City an amount equal to the appraised value of such land.

Requires the Secretary, before conveying the land, to conduct an appraisal of such land in accordance with specified standards.

Instructs the City and the Secretary to each pay certain costs of the appraisal.

Requires any lands acquired under this Act to be included in Tongass National Forest and to be administered by the Secretary in accordance with the laws (including regulations) and forest plan applicable to such Forest.

Requires the amount received by the City to be used by the City to acquire the Craig cannery property.

Authorizes appropriations.

Requires the amount received by the City to be used by the City to acquire the Craig cannery property.

Craig Recreation Land Purchase Act - Requires that if the City of Craig, Alaska (the City), receives a copy of the appraisal conducted under this Act and offers to convey all right, title, and interest of the City in and to specified non-Federal land to the Secretary of Agriculture, the Secretary shall: (1) accept such offer; and (2) on conveyance of the land to the Secretary, pay to the City an amount equal to the appraised value of such land.

item.title: A bill to authorize a land conveyance between the United State and the City of Craig, Alaska, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
